intro: Alcea digitata, commonly known as the fingerflower, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Alcea digitata prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
